snippet: Amnesty International said that torture, mass shootings, starvation and the use of deadly fumigation chemicals in overcrowded cells have been routinely employed by the Nigerian military.
abstract: Amnesty International issues report, based on years of research, accusing Nigerian military of using torture, mass shootings and starvation during its campaign against Boko Haram terrorist group; report contends that documented abuses constitute war crimes and possible crimes against humanity, and names a number of senior officers it claims are responsible.
lead_paragraph: Amnesty International said that torture, mass shootings, starvation and the use of deadly fumigation chemicals in overcrowded cells have been routinely employed by the Nigerian military.

headline.main: Abuses by Nigeria’s Military Found to Be Rampant in War Against Boko Haram
headline.print_headline: Military in Nigeria Is Accused of Abuses
